sn28.9:4.3: “Reverend, going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, I entered and remained in the cessation of perception and feeling.
sn28.9:4.4: But it didn’t occur to me:
sn28.9:4.5: ‘I am entering the cessation of perception and feeling’ or ‘I have entered the cessation of perception and feeling’ or ‘I am emerging from the cessation of perception and feeling’.”
sn28.9:4.6: “That must be because Venerable Sāriputta has long ago totally uprooted ego, possessiveness, and the tendency to conceit.
sn28.9:4.7: That’s why it didn’t occur to you:
sn28.9:4.8: ‘I am entering the cessation of perception and feeling’ or ‘I have entered the cessation of perception and feeling’ or ‘I am emerging from the cessation of perception and feeling’.”
